# Aden Expedition

expedition of India and captured at Sira by the Royal Navy in 1839, now in the Tower of London.]]
The Aden Expedition was a naval operation that the British Royal Navy carried out in January 1839. Following Britain's decision to invade the Port of Aden as a coaling station for the steamers sailing the new Suez-Bombay route, the Sultan of Lahej, who owned Aden, resisted, which led to a series of skirmishes between the two sides. In response to the incidents, a small force of warships and soldiers of the East India Company were sent to Arabia. The expedition succeeded in defeating the Arab defenders, who held the fortress on Sira Island, and occupied the nearby port of Aden.
Order of battle
Royal Navy:
*, frigate (28 guns)
*, sloop (18 guns)
*, brig (18 guns)
*, schooner (5 guns)
